item.title: Mannosidosis: Treatment and Management
item.description: Mannosidosis, a rare genetic disorder and metabolic anomaly, arises when the body fails to efficiently break down mannose sugar chains. This inability leads to an accumulation of sugar-laden compounds in various cells, tissues, and even urine, disrupting regular bodily functions and skeletal development. Description The onset of Mannosidosis is linked to a genetic inability to produce a specific enzyme vital for lysosomes, the cell’s structures tasked with breaking down proteins, sugars, and fats, and recycling them into other molecules.
